newsitem.title: USA: Bill Gates predicts computer future at conference.
newsitem.headline: Bill Gates predicts computer future at conference.

text.p: Computers will visually identify their users, recognize their voices and talk back probably within the next decade, Microsoft's Bill Gates told a computer conference Tuesday night.
Speaking at the Computer Associates International Inc 20th annual users conference, Gates said, "Microsoft is taking the long-term approach ... spending $2 billion a year on research and development.
"We're working on things like speech recognition, speech synthesization and visual recognition. In the next decade, today's interfaces will be obsolete," he said.
"Computers will listen, talk, see, learn and even screen our mail. And we'll be able to see the response of someone when they read our mail to them," he said.
Earlier Tuesday CA and Microsoft announced an agreement to integrate Microsoft's Internet Explorer browser with CA's Unicenter TNG systems management software.
The two companies said they agreed to work together on systems for managing enterprise applications, including those on the Internet's World Wide Web.

Under the agreement, CA will distribute Internet Explorer 3.0 with its Unicenter TNG software developers kit. Microsoft's ActiveX Controls and "Wolfpack" clustering technology also will be integrated with Unicenter TNG.
